intro: Parosela parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved parosela, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often growing in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
